website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for larger umbrellas, but this base might be too large for use in a small space.
pros: Can be filled with up to 50 pounds of water
Fits in well with any decor
Water plug is hidden by a cover so it blends in with the rest of the base
cons: The base is very large, so it may not be suitable for smaller decks and patios

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and movable with plant dolly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 9’ Abba market umbrella to go into this base. It is easy to assemble and add water. One can slide it around on the ground, but it is challenging. I purchased a 24” Devault Espresso plant dolly. Luckily, the base fits in perfectly and I am now able to move the umbrella with its base effortlessly. (See picture) we had 30-40 mph winds and it didn’t budge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: This Abba Patio round umbrella base/stand is perfect for the round glass patio table! I absolutely love, love it + , it was so easy to Unpackage & put together!!! Exactly what I wanted!!! Thank you Abba Patio & Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: GOODLOOKIN1

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but it works great,, water will drain
customer_reviews.text: Pricey but it works great, , water will drain, won’t rust, very important!! and when you need to move it empty he water, very nice and easily holds up a tilting umbrella
customer_reviews.author: Brian E.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We first filled it with water as it says, umbrella blew over in light breezes, then filled it with sand, same thing. We live in N.J. When I say a light breeze I mean a light breeze. We bought an umbrella recommended for this stand, same company. Very unhappy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wright

customer_reviews.title: surprise
customer_reviews.text: The base of the water tank is very strong, very strong after water injection, and the quality is first-class, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: SOJOY

customer_reviews.title: Stable umbrella stand
customer_reviews.text: It is a very stable and strong stand. It is very easy to assemble and comes with instructions which is very handy. It holds a big umbrella with ease and the adjustment part make it nice and tight. The black color goes well with any color of umbrellas and the bottoms of it sinks into the sandy ground so it won't fall.
customer_reviews.author: Yucong Braten

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, East assembly
customer_reviews.text: I was a little iffy given the price, however decided to take a shot. The base, even though it’s plastic has solidly constructed. I’m pleased with the overall construction of product. It looks really nice in person and VERY EASY to assemble
customer_reviews.author: Global_Entry 🛫

customer_reviews.title: ... Abba Patio 50 lbs Round Patio Umbrella Base looks beautiful on my deck
customer_reviews.text: The Abba Patio 50 lbs Round Patio Umbrella Base looks beautiful on my deck! I was a little taken aback when it arrived and the box was so lite, but I quickly realized this is a base that can be filled with sand or water in order to weigh 50 lbs. We had a heavy wind and rain storm recently, my umbrella was pulled from the base (I'm still not sure how that happened, maybe I didn't have it screwed in tight enough), but the base stayed put. So be very certain that you tighten it very well! Other than that, the base is beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: L. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy, lost 2 umbrellas because it fell over
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with this stand. It’s been completely filled with water and with every rain storm we’ve had, it’s fallen over. It’s caused 2 umbrellas to break already. I was hoping it would’ve withheld storms a little better. These are regular rain storms with 5-10mph winds. Not hurricane winds!
customer_reviews.author: K.Rich

customer_reviews.title: Overall It's Nice Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This Year Summer is Horrible in California. We have Some Decent Backyard. During the Evening all the Family Member wants to sit and have little fun, It's not easy during the Sun. I have already had one and looked one more. I found a good Deal on this. This Very useful for me. It's very easy to install. It comes in a Nice Package. I am very impressed with Package and Material.Once you fill the Water it was able to hold lot of weight and Wind.
customer_reviews.author: SujjiTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Great design!
customer_reviews.text: This by far the best patio umbrella holder I ever used. Lightweight but sturdy. Once fill water then it's heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Chemicals/LEAD warning
customer_reviews.text: Only when you receive the package do you learn of the Warning: "This product can expose you to chemicals, including LEAD, which is known to the State of California (P65) to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm." This key information needs to be on the web page, before you order.
customer_reviews.author: mrsjeb

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Got this yesterday and just put it up. The product came very well packed and had all elements of a good product. Did not see any cheapness in the build. I had a double umbrella that I needed a base for and this, so far, has done a great job - at first sight. It's raining and slightly windy, so I've put it out for a test!
customer_reviews.author: sach

customer_reviews.title: It leaked.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple problem- it leaked. Pretty simple solution- returned it. Looked nice but I didn’t need a little puddle on my patio. We live in a very windy area and I needed a base I knew would stay filled.
customer_reviews.author: JMo

customer_reviews.title: Very good product to hold a patio umbrella in place
customer_reviews.text: Very good product to hold a patio umbrella in place. The only drawback is it doesn't have a good way of holding smaller diameter umbrella rods in place when you insert them into the base. It should come with bushing - type inserts to cover umbrellas with smaller OD rod shafts. The screw down design isn't sufficient to prevent the umbrella from twisting in a mild wind environment.
customer_reviews.author: King'sKid58

customer_reviews.title: HUGE UMBRELLA. LOVE BLUE and will order another soon.
customer_reviews.text: Wow I'm going to buy another to shade my exposed Patio areas where we dont have shade. Be prepared it is HUGE! We bought a water filled 50lb base and it had a 2" diameter. It is a large rod so make sure to buy the base big enough to fit. It has a 1.89" red. Heavy duty because its heavy. Easy to put together. Screw rod in first lol, before placing in base. I learned the hard way. I'm definitely listing this seller. Fast delivery and package was perfect. I'll include a video soon
customer_reviews.author: Mdzhivago

customer_reviews.title: Geneous product, withstands heavy desert winds
customer_reviews.text: Finally a great product and a geneous idea to water fill this container. This product is the best it withstands the very heavy desert winds, the shape is perfect & does not take up much floor space, easy to transport and store once the season is over by emptying the water out of the product, don’t waste money on the cement ones they just fall apart after a year.
customer_reviews.author: MIA

customer_reviews.title: Well made and looks great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice and sturdy stand. It was actually a bit bigger than I thought it would be. The only thing I had an issue with was where the umbrella goes they give you two shim type pieces to help center the umbrella pole. I couldn't get the pole into the base unless I left them out and then put them in after the pole was in there. Not the ideal situation but it worked out anyway. It is just like the pictures and looks really nice with my table and umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: James Reed

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like a sieve
customer_reviews.text: Started to fill with water and noticed the bottom leaking in 3 places....ugh. And no way to contact anyone to send me a working base. So I need to pack it all up and return. You can be sure I won’t buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Baer

customer_reviews.title: Just Right!
customer_reviews.text: Buying this online was difficult for me. It's hard to visualize some items size. It's very large, I put water in it as I used it with a 9 ft umbrella. It works perfectly. I had purchased another one thinking they would all be the same size for whatever umbrella u had. Wrong! The one I picked up in person could not hold the umbrella...not strong enough. So I needed the larger size, and the water to put in it to hold my large umbrella. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karyn H.

customer_reviews.title: Very stable
customer_reviews.text: I have two umbrellas on my patio. One is in a metal base, and the other is in this. The metal one is regularly blown over. This one has never tipped - the water filled base provides an excellent counterweight.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S. Hetzner

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with wrong part.
customer_reviews.text: Great product but the bolt to pull the post through was too short, took an extra trip to the hardware store to get a bolt 1" longer. a bit of a hassle but otherwise a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Ken V.

customer_reviews.title: Seriously!?!?
customer_reviews.text: We had been looking forward to receipt of this umbrella stand for a large umbrella we'd purchased. We received the stand this past Sat., and immediately went to our patio to put it to use. Began to fill with water and all of it began to leak out the bottom! We turned the stand over and there is a dime sized hole drilled into the bottom of the stand!! What the heck!?!? This was literally within 20 minutes of receipt - we had to turn around and get the package ready to return. Had to select a "star" to rate this in order to submit my review. However; I would give it a big ZERO!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I gave it three stars because it looks nice and it's durable but not great for securing the ...
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for our roof deck. We filled it completely with sand and that still wasn't heavy enough to prevent from being blown over. Also, it was difficult to properly tighten the base to the umbrella pole--not very secure. I gave it three stars because it looks nice and it's durable but not great for securing the umbrella that I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and hold the umbrella even with a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. Works great so far. Love the fact that it is easily moved once the water is drained. (Using water and not sand. Seems to work fine with just water.)
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very stable
customer_reviews.text: Great base. A little clunky to move. A bit more expensive then others but very stable. Put in about 57 lbs of sand which made it better then water. Very easy to fill. We used play sand
customer_reviews.author: LisaR

customer_reviews.title: It leaks
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking umbrella base. But unfortunately the one I got leaks. It leaks very slowly from the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to take off a star since it felt a little cheaper than expected when I was putting it together and filling it with water. But once I put it under the table and put an umbrella in it I really like it. It holds strong where you set it, but can be moved without too much trouble to relocate it. The angle is right to rest feet on it under the table. I would recommend this as a good stand.
customer_reviews.author: PharmD

customer_reviews.title: perfect for outdoor dinning set
customer_reviews.text: Very well made umbrella base, perfect for outdoor dinning set, easy to assembly and easy to fill with water, the design make it hold the umbrella very firm and all the materials looks good quality, plus it's good looking with my umbrella and with my patio, love it~~
customer_reviews.author: Frank. H

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Heavy enough for our 11' umbrella, even in mild wind.
customer_reviews.author: MadMac333

customer_reviews.title: Nice umbrella base
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy once the water is in! Also, the color (brown) really matches the umbrella that we ordered from Abba. The base is large, which adds to the stability. When the wind and rain came, I forgot to draw down the umbrella, but for once, the umbrella did not blow over! Very impressed. :)
customer_reviews.author: Southern GAL

customer_reviews.title: It's so easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I love this umbrella!! It's lightweight until you add the water. The base is wide so it will not tip over easy. It's as advertised. Worth the money!!!. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: greatgirls

customer_reviews.title: ... the water is living inside but the nicest and good looking. We got ours without a not significant ...
customer_reviews.text: not for ladies 105 lbs and 5'2 to move after the water is living inside but the nicest and good looking. We got ours without a not significant missed part so rather than punishing the environment, we use it without problem and at least a bit relax conscience for doing it that way.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Allegra S.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Umbrella Base
customer_reviews.text: The base was easy to fill with a garden hose. It is not necessary to fill it all the way unless you are expecting strong winds. A partial fill allows for easy relocation of the umbrella and base. The base is made of sturdy plastic and it should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: rootdr

customer_reviews.title: Super Sturdy and Looks Nice
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace the first stand I bought elsewhere, which was simply not heavy enough for my umbrella. One day the umbrella, in the wind, turned inside out. So I bought this stand. It'd heavy, but it holds that new umbrella!
customer_reviews.author: Linda S. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Very stable
customer_reviews.text: Very stable even without water or sand and it is able to accommodate different types of poles.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Leaked.. could have been a defect probably a design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Came with a leak at the crease on the bottom. Really unfortunate. I really like the style and look of it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I have used these all summer and they work as expected even in a good delta breeze place them where you want them fill them with water and put your umbrella in and don't worry about them I will probably order them again next summer if they are available
customer_reviews.author: Doyfus

customer_reviews.title: Just what is advertised, nice design features
customer_reviews.text: Needed a replacement stand and this fit the bill very well. Easy to set up and looks to be quite sturdy. Really nice design features make it work well with various diameter umbrella poles. I like using water in the base for ease of maintenance and it weighs enough for a 10 ft dia. umbrella to be stable.
customer_reviews.author: smeyer

customer_reviews.title: Stable, but leaks water.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very stable base, but when I filled it with water it leaked from the seam in the pole hole. I liked the overall design and base width, so I ended up filling it with sand and it works perfectly. It fit 50 lbs of sand with no problem and that holds the umbrella even through some strong gusts of wind.
customer_reviews.author: Bennie Regenold

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Opened box and began to fill, nice large hole in base, water everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Ibanez

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but will not hold in strong winds
customer_reviews.text: I had two umbrellas take off (one with the stand) during strong winds/storm... and fortunately land in my yard rather than the neighbor's. Overall good quality, easy to fill and not bad to tighten around the umbrella pole. Also easy to roll around the yard with the umbrella in if you want to move it because of the circular shape.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence L.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Held water for a month or two, but now leaks. Company should send me a new one!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Dark

customer_reviews.title: Practical and attractive!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! We needed a base for a 9ft freestanding umbrella where we occasionally get fairly high winds. Even though the base is plastic, it is attractive and well designed. More importantly, the shaft for the umbrella is metal and sturdy. The inserts to allow adjustment to keep the umbrella standing straight are adequate and well thought out. We had two stands previously which failed to keep the umbrella straight due to insufficient weight and quality. Even though this is a recently received product, we are confident that it should be the last umbrella base we will need.
customer_reviews.author: Geak

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I sent this one back and purchased a much higher quality one. Even filled with water there was not enough strength to hold the umbrella up and since it was such thin plastic I knew one good hail storm would trash it. It would probably work in the parts of the country that do not get hail and high winds.
customer_reviews.author: Mower of MuttsTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Solution for tipping patio umbrella due to un-balance
customer_reviews.text: After returning 2 or 3 umbrella bases, found the almost perfect solution for larger patio umbrella that is well-made, sturdy and in balance. Do not see how the umbrella is going to tip over. Overall workmanship is better than other umbrella base which were rated 4.5 or higher. This one is of different class and the manufacturer has made attention to detail and whatever they have put together is well thought out. Highly recommend this product after weeks of futility with other mediocre umbrella bases.
customer_reviews.author: Sae-Jin Kim

customer_reviews.title: Very big! No space for feet under the table.
customer_reviews.text: The product is nice and looks great, but it is big! I purchased this to pair with a 32" round patio table. Unfortunately this stand takes up all the foot space under the table. We have to sit sideways or put our feet on the stand (which is a bit slippery). This product probably more suitable with a larger patio table.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Entire Summer without loosing an umbrella!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it and it has served us well. It has held to holding a pretty large umbrella in very high winds. It’s all we needed because we’ve lost maybe five umbrellas due to smaller bases. It looks nice also.
customer_reviews.author: AREnglish

customer_reviews.title: Base is very sturdy, matches the color of umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Base is very sturdy, matches the color of umbrella, all the tools that I needed to assemble were in the box. It was real easy to set up, directions were included
customer_reviews.author: Marleise Allen

customer_reviews.title: it best to situate the base with the umbrella attached and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this a short time, but so far no problem. It's supporting a freestanding 9' tilting umbrella. I do advise when not in use to fold it. Less chance of blowing in the wind. I foun. it best to situate the base with the umbrella attached and then fill with water.
customer_reviews.author: madi

customer_reviews.title: Fear no wind
customer_reviews.text: We live in Florida where winds get very strong, today winds got to 30 miles an hour,didn't even move the umbrella, so glad I chose this stand among all the rest,works so well,wind is no fear
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Shankles

customer_reviews.title: A good base!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried this would be chintzy looking since it's plastic, but it looks great. It's a simple design so it doesn't jump out to draw attention. It seems durable and does its job! We've had some strong storms, and our umbrella hasn't budged! We are pleased with this base!
customer_reviews.author: J Martin

customer_reviews.title: All function and no esthetics.
customer_reviews.text: Filled with water it will definitely keep your umbrella supported. It's just so big black and clunky. If you have a round table with umbrella mounted in the middle this won't be a concern. I don't have table but wanted something sure to keep my umbrella upright.
customer_reviews.author: Llyllabrat

customer_reviews.title: Get It!  Your Umbrella Stays Put
customer_reviews.text: Great stand. Easily assembles. Doesn't move at all. Grips sides of umbrella so it doesn't blow out of the stand. Little price but worth the stability, as you umbrella will not blow away. Looks nice like the photo. Came quickly and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: DawnBreaking

customer_reviews.title: Works well and has never blown over in the wind.
customer_reviews.text: We highly recommend this umbrella base. Easy to assemble and holds the umbrella well.
customer_reviews.author: sjst

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: does the job. Heavy. more cheap-o plastic-y looking than I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Brin

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: broad base which makes it really stable. even full, you can still tilt it (without umbrella in it) and relocate it to a different place. my neighbor ended buying one as she was impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Seawall

customer_reviews.title: its not really heavy enough with water inside to support ...
customer_reviews.text: its not really heavy enough with water inside to support 9' umbrella if its a little windy. Im going to try change to sand inside to see if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: texas

customer_reviews.title: Unstable for a inch and a half pole---clamps move around--
customer_reviews.text: Cannot keep the pole vertical, clamps loosen, probably works great for two inch pole. Will have to modify--would have been easy fix from factory-
customer_reviews.author: Tappatone

customer_reviews.title: This looks great with the patio umbrella & table
customer_reviews.text: This looks great with the patio umbrella & table. It was easy to set up and fill with water. It does a great job weighing down an umbrella on the pool deck. We live in a very flat, windy area and I haven't had any concerns with this supporting a 9 foot umbrella. It looks very nice and was simply to set-up.
customer_reviews.author: NJMomof2

customer_reviews.title: Good for windy environment
customer_reviews.text: We live in a windy area so needed a heavier base for a 9' umbrella. It was easy to assemble and the brown color matches our patio decor. We have a Trex deck so the base slides easily to reposition the umbrella. The downside is that it is a little large so is more noticeable than a flat metal base.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Work like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: These bases are the best. I filled them with water ( I live in a windy location and they have not budged!). they were easy to set up, came on time, and are made of durable materials that I feel will last long. I simply will empty them for the winter which will make them a breeze to store away. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Black

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works well, held up to some strong winds. Hasn’t failed us yet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold up our umbrella, it blew away twice, was not happy about that!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Well Built and Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and fill with water to provide a steady base for umbrellas that are affixed through the center of a table.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Blew over the first strong wind.
customer_reviews.text: We filled this as recommended and a strong storm blew through and both toppled right over.
customer_reviews.author: vera mcdonnell

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great after two years!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this exact base over 2 years ago (March 2018) and still looks and works great! I looked it up because I want to add another umbrella. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: FAM

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far and looks very attractive
customer_reviews.text: We filled it with water. Works great so far and looks very attractive. Haven't had very strong winds yet, but looks like it will hold the sun umbrella upright if there is a strong wind. Plan to buy another for my second sun umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Word lover

customer_reviews.title: So easy, my 4yo could assemble!
customer_reviews.text: My 4yo helped me set this up. Very easy to use! Looking forward to easily storing it in the garage over winter!
customer_reviews.author: Po's Mama

customer_reviews.title: Love it, looks good and is very sturdy with ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it , looks good and is very sturdy with water in it . The packaging was amazing , definitely would order again !
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Quaco

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking Stabilizing Umbrella Base
customer_reviews.text: I love this umbrella base. It stabilizes my umbrella and looks very nice under the table. It gives a finished look. There is an option of filling it with water, but I did not find it necessary as the water would made it too heavy to move the table even just a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: After having multiple bases break, this one was significantly better and clearly superior from the initial set up. Would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Practical and Attractive
customer_reviews.text: I liked that you can fill and empty with water. Much easier to manage than concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Weiser

customer_reviews.title: It was just too light to actually hold the umbrella ...
customer_reviews.text: It was just too light to actually hold the umbrella straight up without falling in almost any kind of wind
customer_reviews.author: Michael Oprea

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easy to maneuver when empty. Using with a patio table that has a opening for an umbrella which provides additional support. A little less stable than my old metal base, but a trade off for maneuverability and ease of storage. Would get a beaver model to use witH a stand alone umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Michael I.

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well with the wind.
customer_reviews.text: Can be drained to reduce weight and more easily moved.
customer_reviews.author: Modestspender

customer_reviews.title: Base
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella base is basically plastic but it is still a good value. We filled it with sandbox sand for weight. It is very stable and will not blow off our deck unless we have a tornado (which has occurred here). We are happy customers.
customer_reviews.author: pj

customer_reviews.title: buy buy buy!
customer_reviews.text: this is a great umbrella holder with great styling! fills w water or sand and holding my 10 ft with oversized wooden pole beautifully! wish i would’ve bought sooner! worth the $. definitely!!!
customer_reviews.author: chetzy

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for slightly larger umbrella poles
customer_reviews.text: This stand did not disappoint. We had to look around a little because our patio umbrella’s pole that is almost 2 inches in diameter and many stands did not fit it. This stand fits our larger umbrella pole, looks nice and is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. O’Brien

customer_reviews.title: CONSTANT LEAKING
customer_reviews.text: I loved this piece and yes, it can be sturdy with water being added, but the water is constantly leaking out of the bottom. Therefore, it creates an issue of not being stable. It would be a hassle for me to return it not having the box and its also a ton weight to pack up in something else so unfortunately, I am stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have a 15 foot rectangular umbrella and this base is very secure...I used water but you can use sand...love it
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fill (sand) and is secure for umbrella base. Not easy to maneuver, based on its purpose you wouldn’t want it to be.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hopewell

customer_reviews.title: perfect for our patio
customer_reviews.text: The patio umbrella base is very sturdy and still. I compared several models and decided to buy this one. it comes in a nice package and when we installed, It fits our umbrella very well. My husband is very happy for this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zhao Zhao

customer_reviews.title: As described- good purchase. Very sturdy - heavy weight without having ...
customer_reviews.text: As described- good purchase. Very sturdy - heavy weight without having to sand or water into base. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S. Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Huge Umbrella base
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella base is huge, I didn’t expect it to be that big. The quality is solid even though it is made of plastic. It was very well packaged and no sign of damage.
customer_reviews.author: Ajey

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, only gave 4 stars because I think the price is high for a plastic base. Filled with 25 bag of kitty litter.
customer_reviews.author: amazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it's fairly weatherproof and seems very sturdy. I wish there was a better way 2 keep it from spinning and the knob at the bottom that tightens the hold seems like it could be stronger but maybe that's because the umbrellas not supposed to be up in the real strong winds anyway. Overall it seems to be a good value for the money and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: george feger

customer_reviews.title: Real quality...not flimsy plastic
customer_reviews.text: My biggest concern was that all sellers say "quality' but I was afraid this would be flimsy plastic. Not so...all the pieces justified what I paid for it. Extra thought was put into this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stand
customer_reviews.text: great, does work great if your putting the umbrella to stand on its own.
customer_reviews.author: yovanka c. lavalliere

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to add the water to keep the umbrella sturdy. Much easier than using sand.
customer_reviews.author: MARILYN

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking large base. Filled it with water from lake. Using to anchor umbrella through patio table at dock on large lake. Seems very sturdy and stable.
customer_reviews.author: Ro S

customer_reviews.title: ... a water fill for weight holder but makes for easy transport to where it goes
customer_reviews.text: This is a water fill for weight holder but makes for easy transport to where it goes.. Easy set up/ fill up.. happy I got it..
customer_reviews.author: E. B. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Umbrella Stand
customer_reviews.text: It's really good but wish it was a bit smaller
customer_reviews.author: Sharondea

customer_reviews.title: After filling it with water, it's heavy and has ...
customer_reviews.text: After filling it with water, it's heavy and has done the job holding the umbrella in place. It has worked for us and we live in Texas where there is almost always a stiff breeze.
customer_reviews.author: John McNatt

customer_reviews.title: Heavy enough, but can be moved fairly easily by sliding
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. The squirrel has not yet toppled my half-umbrella as he did with the half-round.
customer_reviews.author: Sallie50

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy base
customer_reviews.text: This was our fifth try for a sturdy umbrella base, and this is great! We don't have to remove our umbrella if the wind blows--because this base is so heavy.
customer_reviews.author: doni-rae

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for the umbrella we ordered. Plenty of weight when full of water
customer_reviews.author: E. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Quality umbrella stand
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, quality shows. It looks well made - nice design (a bonus for a water-fill (so many are pretty tacky looking) - good size/weight - easy to assemble, and most importantly, it seems really sturdy and made to function and last.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Works great in high wind wind loaded with water with umbrella down Easier to move then previous concrete Models
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely 1st Class
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected. Well made, sturdy and easy to assemble (2-minutes) and use.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Wilson

product_meta.title: Abba Patio 50lb Patio Umbrella Base Water Filled 23" Round Recyclable Plastic Outdoor Market Umbrella Stand Base for Deck, Lawn, Garden, Brown
feature_bullets: Weather Resistant Materials: The round base is made of high quality weather and wear-resistant recycled plastic that is UV protected. The heavy duty steel base tube is protected with a TIGER Drylac powder coating to help prevent rust, chipping, peeling and corrosion for years to come.

Up to 50 lbs of Weight: When empty, this base is lightweight and easy to carry to a location. When filled with water, it can hold up to 50 lbs. to keep your 6' - 11' patio umbrella in place. You can use this free standing or with a pole through a table. It is ok to use sand and water but we recomment water for this base.

Adjustable Base Tube with Hand Tightening Knob: The heavy duty steel base tube is the part that holds your umbrella in place. This adjustable base tube will hold an umbrella pole between 1.5" - 2" diameter. The hand tightening knob offers a secure grip for tightening the position of the umbrella pole. Turn it one way to tighten into place and the opposite way to loosen it.
Easy to Clean and Assemble: Hose down or wipe with a cloth when needed. This base is low maintenance. Assembly is easy with no tools needed.
Dimensions: The round base has a 23 inch diameter; Height: 14.6 inches.
